intro: Turraea trichostylis, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
